raw_affiliation_strings: NADIM ROUHANA is Assistant Professor of Psychology at Boston College. He is a founding member of the Program on International Conflict Analysis and Resolution at the Center for International Affairs at Harvard

he is also an associate of the Center where he co-chairs the seminar on International Conflict Analysis and Resolution. His research has centered on group identity, intergroup relations, dynamics of conflict, and theory and application of conflict resolution.

affiliations.raw_affiliation_string: NADIM ROUHANA is Assistant Professor of Psychology at Boston College. He is a founding member of the Program on International Conflict Analysis and Resolution at the Center for International Affairs at Harvard

he is also an associate of the Center where he co-chairs the seminar on International Conflict Analysis and Resolution. His research has centered on group identity, intergroup relations, dynamics of conflict, and theory and application of conflict resolution.

raw_affiliation_strings: HERBERT C. KELMAN is Richard Clarke Cabot Professor of Social Ethics at Harvard University and Director of the Program on International Conflict Analysis and Resolution at the Harvard Center for International Affairs. He has been an active and devoted member of SPSSI since 1946. He was SPSSI President in 1964- 1965
chair or member of various SPSSI committees over the years
editor of a SPSSI-sponsored volume, International Behavior: A Social-Psychological Analysis (1965)

editor of or contributor to many issues of the Journal of Social Issues. His most recent book is Crimes of Obedience: Toward a Social Psychology of Authority and Responsibility, co-authored with V. Lee Hamilton and published by Yale University Press in 1989.
recipient of SPSSI's Kurt Lewin Memorial Award in 1973

affiliations.raw_affiliation_string: editor of a SPSSI-sponsored volume, International Behavior: A Social-Psychological Analysis (1965)

KELMAN is Richard Clarke Cabot Professor of Social Ethics at Harvard University and Director of the Program on International Conflict Analysis and Resolution at the Harvard Center for International Affairs. editor of or contributor to many issues of the Journal of Social Issues. His most recent book is Crimes of Obedience: Toward a Social Psychology of Authority and Responsibility, co-authored with V. Lee Hamilton and published by Yale University Press in 1989.

raw_affiliation_strings: DAVID BARGAL is a senior lecturer at the Paul Baerwald School of Social Work at the Hebrew University, Jerusalem. His areas of interest and research include group and intergroup relations and organizational behavior in the human services. He served as a consultant to the Ford Foundation action research project reported here. Recently he translated into Hebrew and edited a collection of Lewin's writings.
